interlinear-text.item: ELA Life as a Wakhi - Russian

phrase.item: Hello! My name is Milana.
My parents call me Milanchik.
I am from Shetkharv village, which is located in Wakhan, Tajikistan.
However, I was born in Moscow. I was raised and graduated from my high school here.
Currently, I am attending university here.
Although I am living among Russians, I haven't forgotten my Wakhi language.
My parents are really trying so that we should not forget our mother [father] tongue and our culture as well.
For whoever doesn't believe it, I am going to recite a song for you
about the land of the Wakhan - so I'm going to recite it.
The song I am going to sing was written by a teacher, Saodatsho from Darshay, Wakhan.
Let's go to Wakhan, the homeland,
the Wakhan homeland is my body and soul.
Speak nothing bad of the Wakhan homeland,
God has given it to us.
Come, let's go look around,
The Wakhan homeland is so beautiful.
In this world, the Wakhan homeland —
God has given it to us.
All over the Wakhan homeland are
gold, rubies, and marble.
Not bad is his [?],
God has given it to us.
There are many holy places there,
and the footsteps of holy people.
Come, you won't regret it,
God has given it to us.
The Wakhan homeland is covered with flowers,
the Wakhan homeland is full of holy places.
All those holy places are holy
which God has given to us.
Dear Wakhi brothers and sisters!
In whatever part of the world you may be,
never forget your language and culture!
